intro: Eriastrum densifolium subsp. densifolium, commonly known as the denseleaf eriastrum, is a flowering plant native to California. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its herbaceous growth habit and distinctive seed heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. It features small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its dense foliage and compact form make it a notable species in local flora and ecological studies.
